page.title: 06TAKELEY, THE SCHOOL
page.content: Takeley School is situated in Roseacres; it was built in 1964 as a temporary school but we are still using it in 1985. The building is in a bad state of repair. There are 7 classrooms, a visual aids room where we watch television, a hall where we have P.E. and outside there is a swimming pool, two playgrounds and a field. There are 209 pupils in our school, we have 7 teachers and our headmaster is Mr Harris. We also have some parents who come in to help. There is 1 secretary, 4 mid day assistants, 2 cooks, 2 cleaners and a caretaker. 18% of the children have school dinners, 77% have sandwiches and 5% go home. We have a selection of school pets. We have 2 BBC computers and so we are able to take part in the Domesday project.
